metadata.title: Convert Liters to US Gallons – Volume Converter
metadata.description: Convert volume from Liters (L) to US Gallons, useful for fuel capacity and volume understanding.

introduction: This converter transforms volume measurements from Liters to US Gallons, enabling fuel capacity interpretation.
International fuel measurements use liters while US vehicles use gallons. Converting helps with capacity comparison.
This converter uses the standard relationship where 1 US gallon equals approximately 3.78541 liters.
methodology: 1 US gallon ≈ 3.78541 liters. To convert liters to gallons, divide by 3.78541. For example, 4 L ≈ 1.06 gal, 50 L ≈ 13.2 gal.
Understanding fuel tank capacity in familiar units helps with vehicle purchasing decisions.
International recipe conversions often require liter to gallon conversions for accurate ingredient measurement.
This converter provides precise volume conversions.
examples: Example 1 – Fuel tank: A 60-liter fuel tank holds approximately 15.85 gallons.
Example 2 – Recipe scaling: A 5-liter batch recipe serves approximately 1.32 gallons worth of product.
Example 3 – Container size: A 10-liter water container is approximately 2.64 gallons.

faqs.question: What is the conversion from Liters to US Gallons?
faqs.answer: 1 US gallon ≈ 3.78541 L. Divide liters by 3.78541 to get US gallons.

faqs.question: How efficient is my car's fuel economy?
faqs.answer: Divide 235.214 by liters per 100 km to get miles per gallon equivalent.
